member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeRequest
member.summary: Base class for PersonalizeRuntime operation requests.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetPersonalizedRanking operation. Re-ranks a list of recommended items for the given user. The first item in the list is deemed the most likely item to be of interest to the user.
The solution backing the campaign must have been created using a recipe of type PERSONALIZED_RANKING.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingRequest.CampaignArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CampaignArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the campaign to use for generating the personalized ranking.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingRequest.Context
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Context.
The contextual metadata to use when getting recommendations. Contextual metadata includes any interaction information that might be relevant when getting a user's recommendations, such as the user's current location or device type.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingRequest.FilterArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a filter you created to include items or exclude items from recommendations for a given user. For more information, see Filtering Recommendations.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingRequest.FilterValues
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterValues.
The values to use when filtering recommendations. For each placeholder parameter in your filter expression, provide the parameter name (in matching case) as a key and the filter value(s) as the corresponding value. Separate multiple values for one parameter with a comma.
For filter expressions that use an INCLUDE element to include items, you must provide values for all parameters that are defined in the expression. For filters with expressions that use an EXCLUDE element to exclude items, you can omit the filter-values.In this case, Amazon Personalize doesn't use that portion of the expression to filter recommendations.
For more information, see Filtering Recommendations.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingRequest.InputList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InputList.
A list of items (by itemId) to rank. If an item was not included in the training dataset, the item is appended to the end of the reranked list. The maximum is 500.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingRequest.UserId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserId.
The user for which you want the campaign to provide a personalized ranking.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetPersonalizedRanking operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingResponse.PersonalizedRanking
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PersonalizedRanking.
A list of items in order of most likely interest to the user. The maximum is 500.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingResponse.RecommendationId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommendationId.
The ID of the recommendation.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetRecommendations operation. Returns a list of recommended items. The required input depends on the recipe type used to create the solution backing the campaign, as follows:
RELATED_ITEMS - itemId required, userId not used
USER_PERSONALIZATION - itemId optional, userId required
Campaigns that are backed by a solution created using a recipe of type PERSONALIZED_RANKING use the API.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest.CampaignArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CampaignArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the campaign to use for getting recommendations.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest.Context
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Context.
The contextual metadata to use when getting recommendations. Contextual metadata includes any interaction information that might be relevant when getting a user's recommendations, such as the user's current location or device type.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest.FilterArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterArn.
The ARN of the filter to apply to the returned recommendations. For more information, see Filtering Recommendations.
When using this parameter, be sure the filter resource is ACTIVE.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest.FilterValues
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterValues.
The values to use when filtering recommendations. For each placeholder parameter in your filter expression, provide the parameter name (in matching case) as a key and the filter value(s) as the corresponding value. Separate multiple values for one parameter with a comma.
For filter expressions that use an INCLUDE element to include items, you must provide values for all parameters that are defined in the expression. For filters with expressions that use an EXCLUDE element to exclude items, you can omit the filter-values.In this case, Amazon Personalize doesn't use that portion of the expression to filter recommendations.
For more information, see Filtering Recommendations.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest.ItemId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ItemId.
The item ID to provide recommendations for.
Required for RELATED_ITEMS recipe type.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest.NumResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NumResults.
The number of results to return. The default is 25. The maximum is 500.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest.UserId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserId.
The user ID to provide recommendations for.
Required for USER_PERSONALIZATION recipe type.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetRecommendations operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsResponse.ItemList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ItemList.
A list of recommendations sorted in ascending order by prediction score. There can be a maximum of 500 items in the list.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsResponse.RecommendationId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommendationId.
The ID of the recommendation.

The and APIs return a list of PredictedItems.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.PredictedItem.Score

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeClient
member.summary: Implementation for accessing PersonalizeRuntime

member.name: M:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeClient.GetPersonalizedRanking(Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingRequest)
member.summary:
Re-ranks a list of recommended items for the given user. The first item in the list is deemed the most likely item to be of interest to the user.
The solution backing the campaign must have been created using a recipe of type PERSONALIZED_RANKING.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetPersonalizedRanking service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetPersonalizedRanking service method, as returned by PersonalizeRuntime.
member.exception: Provide a valid value for the field or parameter.
The specified resource does not exist.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetPersonalizedRanking Operation

member.summary:
Re-ranks a list of recommended items for the given user. The first item in the list is deemed the most likely item to be of interest to the user.
The solution backing the campaign must have been created using a recipe of type PERSONALIZED_RANKING.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetPersonalizedRanking service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the GetPersonalizedRanking service method, as returned by PersonalizeRuntime.
member.exception: Provide a valid value for the field or parameter.
The specified resource does not exist.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetPersonalizedRanking Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeClient.GetRecommendations(Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest)
member.summary:
Returns a list of recommended items. The required input depends on the recipe type used to create the solution backing the campaign, as follows:
RELATED_ITEMS - itemId required, userId not used
USER_PERSONALIZATION - itemId optional, userId required
Campaigns that are backed by a solution created using a recipe of type PERSONALIZED_RANKING use the API.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetRecommendations service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetRecommendations service method, as returned by PersonalizeRuntime.
member.exception: Provide a valid value for the field or parameter.
The specified resource does not exist.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetRecommendations Operation

member.summary:
Returns a list of recommended items. The required input depends on the recipe type used to create the solution backing the campaign, as follows:
RELATED_ITEMS - itemId required, userId not used
USER_PERSONALIZATION - itemId optional, userId required
Campaigns that are backed by a solution created using a recipe of type PERSONALIZED_RANKING use the API.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetRecommendations service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
